alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 21 at 11:44AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Areas along Highway 101 south of Salinas in Monterey County. * WHEN...Until 145 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1142 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding along Highway 101. Between 0.2 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Soledad, Greenfield, King City, Gonzales and Chualar. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
